results.corpus:
Introduction to Kinship and Dominance

Course Description:
This course is designed to introduce students to the study of kinship and dominant power structures. We will explore the role of kinship in social organizations, the impact of dominance on culture and the individual, and the ways in which kinship and dominance interact to shape social life. 

Course Goals: 
By the end of this course, students should be able to:
1. Describe the concept of kinship and its role in social organizations.
2. Analyze the impact of dominant power structures on culture and the individual.
3. Evaluate the relationship between kinship and dominance in social life.

Course Requirements:
• Class attendance and participation: Students are expected to attend class regularly and to participate in class discussions and activities.
• Assignments: Students will be required to complete a series of assignments, including essays, presentations, and research projects.
• Final Exam: Students will be required to take a comprehensive final exam.

Grading: 
• Class attendance and participation: 10%
• Assignments: 70%
• Final Exam: 20%

Texts and Resources:
• Readings from primary and secondary sources will be provided by the instructor. 
• Online resources, such as websites and scholarly journals, are also required.

Course Schedule:
Week 1: Introduction to Kinship
Week 2: Types of Kinship
Week 3: Kinship and Social Organization
Week 4: Dominant Power Structures
Week 5: The Impact of Dominance
Week 6: Kinship and Dominance
Week 7: Final Exam

Academic Integrity:
Students are expected to maintain academic integrity in all course assignments and activities. Plagiarism, cheating, and other forms of academic dishonesty will not be tolerated.
